Description: Upper body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery amphora, type B; neck glazed; palmette-lotus frieze, casually painted and incised, above figured zone in which are the remains of a figure with incision for the hairline.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 72, no. 237 pl. 53)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0887)
